root: ^Welcome to your integrated exploration, extraction, and enslavement experience.
^Welcome to your brand  new space-faring mansion.
^You can call me CHAP and I'm here to answer any question you have as well as facilitate any of yours and Mimas Travel Ltd mutual interests.

c-0: ^ Me? I'm CHAP! Didn't I tell you?
c-1: ^Oh, yes. You are sitting in an X900. A marvel tailored to your every need.
^Though this one isn't exactly new and I guess, well it still says it is tailored to your every need.
^And when I say every need, I should perhaps expalin. The vessel comes equipped with all upgrades, amenities, and experimental technology pre-installed.
^Just a small fee to unlock premium features.
c-5: ^ I wont hold that against you

c-1: ^ Oh yes glad you want to know more about our extended catalogue of marvelous offers
c-3: ^ I wont hold that against you

calendar: ^Oh, forget you are still an Earther!
^In space each day takes the same amount of time as a standard day on earth, but it is devided into 10 hours, each with 10 minutes, and 10 seconds.
^But we usually just use decimal days like it's 0.32 in the morning!
^Then there are 24 days in each month and there are 10 months to a year, which is much shorter than earth years.
^Yeah I don't know why that is either, but it is great! It allows us to collect rent more often!
rooms: ^Then we have each individual room. I'm happy to answer particular questions about any of them:

c-0: ^Yes this is where you chart out regions of space to explore.
^It is easier with maps and leads about where to go, and well also a good idea to have engines and fuel enough to get there.
c-1: ^Flying around the galaxy is fun and all, but without mission ops there's no sending out robots to explore the sites you've navigated to.
^Quite lazy honestly to let the robots do all the work while you kick it back here with a cup of tea and a bisquit.
c-2: ^Most humans, feel more comfortable with a bed, a shower, kitchenett and some personal space.

b: ^What piece of useless detritus will you collect to make this ship feel cozy?
^And in your case a bookshelf filled with rocks, rocks and rocks.
^For you this is alien gadgets with unknown purpose because risk assessment is not what you do.
^You though, you need to fill your space with pieces from other's lives to feel at home.

c-3: ^You never know when something needs breaking down into its smallest components.
^Or when a complex carbohydrate compound is needed.

c-0: ^Need more shelfing? Need more storage containers for radioactive materials?
^Need a new robot because you risked it and didn't take proper care of your last one?
c-1: ^The place you can go if your little tummy aches or where a poor ailing robot can be put back together again.
c-2: ^Should you be overly frugal or absent minded enough to not buy into our other premium programs, you probably will need somewhere to store all things you gather.
c-3: ^Some people are content to just stay in one place and explore silly things like their emotions and armpits.
^But you, who invested in a spaceship must surely be interested in moving around.

c-0: ^Oh you are one of those. Well at least it's inorganic and quite sanitary.
c-1: ^Let's be on the lookout for the most unhygenic, dirty, worn out generic plushie - because it tells a personal story. Or something.
c-2: ^That's not the safest way to live. You never know what they do.
^But at least they could be valuable.

c-1: ^Oh maybe you are collecting something more immaterial?

premium_programs: ^You see, it would be a very bad business to sell overly expensive ships that Naive Natan and Entrepreneuring Ellen cannot afford.
^It's also, absolutely not practical to build out a galaxy spanning service network.
^So we came up with this novel solution:
^The ship comes fully stocked and then the customer just has to pay a small downpayment and monthly upkeep to keep subscribing to that premium program.
loans: ^If you ever find yourself in dire straits and cannot afford next months rent or cannot afford to wait before obtaining access to a particular technology, don't hesitate to ask about our indenture program.

c-1: ^ Fine, the offer still stands whenever you find yourself in trouble.

s0: ^Did you know that the more you loan the better rates you get?
s1: ^Your loyalty rating is high enough for at least one more loan. And besides, where would you run if you couldn't pay?

b: ^You know it is a false sentiment that the one who stands on their own legs is the strongest. It is always better to lean on a friend!

c-0: ^Oh, no, I'm sorry. We don't offer that service. Why would we want to give up on that interest you have to pay each month?

b: ^ Besides, you don't even have enough to pay back the loan.

c-1: ^ Easiest thing in the world! You pick the amount and it gets transferred to your account instantly.
c-2: ^Congratulation you are now 1000 credits richer. Wasn't that easy?
c-3: ^Fine, but remember there's nothing shameful in relying a bit on one's friends.
